document_data.name: Lemon Fish
document_data.mainbody: '''Lemon fishes''' were a species of [[fish]] unique to subterranean pools and streams.
document_data.Description:
The average length of an adult lemon fish varied widely, ranging anything from {{SIrange|2|6|ft|long=yes}} in length, thus unlike many fish species a specimen's size was not indicative of its age. Their tails were covered with yellow and black barbs as well as had a 
thin, spike up to {{SI|2|ft|long=yes}} in length, that extending beyond them. Their eyes were black saucers that would close when they moving in on prey and they had two rows of teeth within their mouth.

The lemon was covered in bright yellow scales, from which its comparison to [[lemon]]s was derived, though some viewing them from above described the fishes as resembling [[gold piece]]s. Their dorsal fins were tipped with black scales and resembled that of a [[shark]] whenever the lemon fish broke the surface of the water.
document_data.Behavior: When not hungry, lemon fishes were a rather docile and largely harmless species. When hungry though, they were more than willing to attack creatures larger than themselves.

Biology.Reproduction: Four times per year a lemon fish would lay bundles of a hundred to six-hundred eggs. On average only ten of every hundred lemon fish would survive to reach adulthood. Their eggs were also quite edible.

document_data.Combat: Lemon fishes fought by biting with their dual rows of teeth and lashing out with their barbed tails.

Ecology.Diet: The lemon fish was a carnivorous species and enjoyed the taste of flesh. They were known to prey upon schools of [[wattley]]s, another uniquely subterranean species of fish.
Ecology.Habitats: The lemon fish was only found in subterranean bodies of fresh water where luminous [[lichen]] or other sources provided an environment that approximated natural lighting. They were especially prominent in the underground caverns of [[Undermountain]], where the [[River Sargauth]] and the streams of [[Wyllowwood]] flowed down.
Ecology.Usage: The organs of a lemon fish were highly prized by both [[duergar]] and [[drow]]. Their eggs also fetched prices of up to 400 [[gp]] per {{SI|1|lbs.|k}}, which was equivalent to six-hundred eggs.
